item.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverParty for Socialism and Liberation - PSLMany people in the United States today consider W.E.B. Du...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverParty for Socialism and Liberation - PSL

Many people in the United States today consider W.E.B. Du Bois to be a household name - and it’s not difficult to understand why. One of the founding members of... the NAACP, the first Black man to receive a doctorate from Harvard, and a prolific author, his personal achievements and contributions to Black liberation deserve enduring attention and celebration.

W.E.B Du Bois was born in 1868 amidst the Reconstruction Era in the United States, the heroic efforts of former enslaved Africans to form their own governments in the South after the Civil War, and remained a constant influence on Du Bois throughout his life. His history of the period ‘Black Reconstruction’ remains a classic to this day.

DuBois emerged as the main ideological opponent of Booker T. Washington and his Atlanta Compromise, a strategy that encouraged Black people to submit to white supremacist rule, and resign themselves to uplift via trade schools — not to struggle for civil and political rights or equal education. DuBois challenged this arrangement head-on, forming the Niagara Movement, then the NAACP, which fought racist inequality in the full range of U.S. institutions.

W.E.B. Du Bois’ commitment to Black liberation did not stop at the borders of the US. Du Bois stressed Pan-Africanism as a fundamental tenet in his philosophy of liberation. He attended the first and second Pan-African Conferences, meeting revolutionary leaders from around the world.

Du Bois’ international solidarity took him on travels throughout the world, studying worldwide fights against oppression. Like many other revolutionaries throughout history, Du Bois came to accept socialism as the only way to end the oppression of all people. His visits to the Soviet Union and revolutionary China resulted in the McCarthy Era US government trying him as an international spy in a theatrical trial. In the last year of his life, Du Bois became an active member of the Communist Party of the USA, stating proudly, “I believe in communism. I mean by communism, a planned way of life in the production of wealth and work designed for building a state whose object is the highest welfare of its people and not merely the profit of a part."

See More
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: HAPPENING NOW: Call in to Aurora City Council public comment at...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver was live.

HAPPENING NOW: Call in to Aurora City Council public comment at 855-695-3475, press *3. Call before 7:30 or you may be pushed to the end of the meeting.

Demand Justice for Elijah McClain! The newly released report from the independent investigation commissioned by the city of Aurora confirms what we already knew: Elijah McClain was unjustly, illegally, brutally murdered and APD, AFD, and the city of Aurora did everything in their power to cover it up.

Demand the immediate firing of APD officers Woodyard and Roedema (Rosenblatt as fired for mocking Elijah's death), and AFD paramedic Cooper and lieutenant Cichuniec NOW!

1.2K Views
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverNational Committee for Justice in DenverBREAKING: Independent investigation initiated by the city...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverNational Committee for Justice in Denver

BREAKING: Independent investigation initiated by the city of Aurora just returned with its results.

It found there was no legal basis for the Aurora Police to s...top, frisk, or choke Elijah McClain.

Paramedics didn’t check on Elijah or even examine him before injecting him with an enormous dose of ketamine.

The initial investigators crafted questions to help exonerate the officers.

To this day the only people to face charges related to Elijah McClain’s death are the activists who led peaceful protests demanding justice.

Learn more at denverdefense.org
Read the report at auroragov.org

#JusticeforElijahMcClain
#DroptheChargesCO

item.title: Reds in Ed Webinar: Teachers Struggle for a Safe Reopening An...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Reds in Ed Webinar: Teachers Struggle for a Safe Reopening

An extremely important conversation featuring teachers from all over the country who are fighting for safe reopening plans. Tune in and stand with teachers!

Party for Socialism and Liberation - PSL was live.

With over 27 million people infected by COVID-19 and almost half a million dead, local and federal governments continue pushing for full school reopenings aroun...d the country. In almost a year since the pandemic changed our lives, cities and small towns still do not have rapid testing, PPE or vaccination procedures to meet the needs of workers.

President Biden said schools should reopen "safely" and yet communities are waiting for the funding and resources necessary to make that happen. From Chicago to San Francisco to Philadelphia, teachers and families are fighting for a safe reopening of in-person teaching and for the resources communities need to survive the economic crisis.

See More

item.title: ⚠️ #JusticeforElijahMcClain Movement Alert ⚠️ Results of...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

⚠️ #JusticeforElijahMcClain Movement Alert ⚠️ Results of the city’s investigation into the death of Elijah McClain coming Monday

The investigation only looks into whether the involved cops and firefighters violated department policy, not for criminality.

We don’t want results that just sound good. We want accountability. We want safety for our community. FIRE all the officers and paramedics involved in Elijah’s murder. NOTHING less.

...

And remember, #EyesonWeiser! We demand murder charges for Woodyard, Roedema, and Rosenblatt from the state investigation!

item.title: Sign this petition from Jewish Voice for Peace to protect the...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Sign this petition from Jewish Voice for Peace to protect the freedom to criticize Israeli apartheid and their genocidal policies against the Palestinian people!

“The Israeli government and some of its supporters are asking Facebook to add “Zionist” as a protected category in its hate speech policy — that is, to treat "Zionist" as a proxy for "Jew" or "Jewish.”

Facebook, we need to talk — and you're not letting us. So we're launching a campaign to make sure you do....
Cooperating with the Israeli government's request would undermine efforts to dismantle antisemitism, deprive Palestinians of a crucial venue for expressing their political viewpoints to the world, and help the Israeli government avoid accountability for its violations of Palestinian rights.”

See MoreTell Mark Zuckerberg and Sheryl Sandberg that we need to talk: Adding the word “Zionist” as a protected category in Facebook’s hate speech policy only serves to build more walls to keep us apart.

act.jewishvoiceforpeace.org

Facebook, we need to talk.

Tell Mark Zuckerberg and Sheryl Sandberg that we need to talk: Adding the word “Zionist” as a protected category in Facebook’s hate speech policy only serves to build more walls to keep us apart.Tell Mark Zuckerberg and Sheryl Sandberg that we need to talk: Adding the word “Zionist” as a protected category in Facebook’s hate speech policy only serves to build more walls to keep us apart.

item.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverParty for Socialism and Liberation - PSL"Black, lesbian, mother, warrior, poet." From a young...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverParty for Socialism and Liberation - PSL

"Black, lesbian, mother, warrior, poet." From a young age, Audre Lorde expressed herself through poetry, often speaking through poems she memorized and recited....

Through her poetry, essays, novels, and other writings, Audre Lorde powerfully criticized all oppressions people face under a racist, sexist, homophobic capitalist system.

She was one of the first people to comprehensively write about the concept of intersectionality, though she never used this term.

Though celebrated today, Lorde was excluded from the mainstream feminist movement of her time, which was dominated by white women who refused to acknowledge the ways women of different races experience sexism, and often were overtly racist. Audre totally rejected the way many mainstream feminists encouraged other women to compartmentalize their identities and identify with their gender before the other aspects of their person. In contrast, she celebrated all parts of her multi-faceted identity equally and all the ways the different parts of a person make them whole.

In her famous essay, "The Master’s Tools Will Never Dismantle the Master’s House," Audre Lorde called on all women to find strength in the myriad ways different people experience womanhood.

She wrote: “Those of us who stand outside the circle of this society's definition of acceptable women; those of us who have been forged in the crucibles of difference -- those of us who are poor, who are lesbians, who are Black, who are older -- know that survival is not an academic skill. It is learning how to take our differences and make them strengths. For the master's tools will never dismantle the master's house.”

Audre Lorde spent her lifetime confronting issues of oppression under capitalism and inspiring others to do the same. We honor her legacy each time we band together to dismantle all tools of oppression, one at a time.

See More
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: “The spectacular failure of the power grid and historic low...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

“The spectacular failure of the power grid and historic low temperatures have exacerbated other infrastructure problems and collided with other forms of local and state neglect. Bursting water pipes have caused the evacuation of entire apartment complexes as ice-cold water forces residents to flee into snow-covered streets. Mutual aid groups across the state scrambled to get bus tickets and supplies to homeless camps that were left to die by municipal governments, with hours ...counting down before the streets became undriveable or curfews were enforced. Residents who need shelter are being asked to make reservations over the phone and make the trek themselves, even though local governments have not cleared the streets for driving and public transportation is not running. Cities which lost power at their water treatment facilities are asking residents who also don’t have power to boil their water to make it potable.

City, state, and private entities alike are deflecting blame, claiming that there was nothing they could have done. ‘You can’t predict the weather’ and ‘We all need to conserve energy’ are common refrains. But the weather was absolutely predictable, and experts and activists alike have been warning that Texas is in danger of exactly this kind of complete infrastructure collapse.“

Read the full article:

See MoreFour million or more Texans are without power. Outages that were initially called “rolling outages” are now lasting several days. The private non-profit corporation that oversees the electric grid is now admitting that they are “unable to predict” when... #environment #naturaldisaster #texas

liberationnews.org

Texas infrastructure nears complete collapse as capitalist neglect...

item.title: Leonard Peltier is 76 years old. He has spent the last 45 years...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Leonard Peltier is 76 years old. He has spent the last 45 years in prisoner for a crime he didn’t commit, targeted by the FBI for his participation in the American Indian Movement. He suffers from serious health issues, which in addition to his age, make him extremely vulnerable to the coronavirus.

It is more urgent than EVER to fight for clemency for Leonard and to send him letters of solidarity and encouragement. We must remember and fight for the political prisoners who have paid dearly for their role in the struggle for justice and liberation.

Join us tonight at 7pm via the link bit.ly/freeleonard213 to watch a documentary about Leonard’s case and write letters to him in prison. Free Leonard Peltier! Film-Screening & Letter-Writing

Watch the powerful short documentary film about the activists facing decades in prison for leading peaceful protests for #JusticeforElijahMcClain

Visit DenverDefense.org to donate, sign the petition to #DroptheChargesCO, and learn how else you can support.

BreakThrough News

The only people charged over the brutal police murder of Elijah McClain are community activists who organized mass peaceful demonstrations calling for justice. ...They are facing up to 48 years in prison - among the highest charges for peaceful political protest in recent history.

Watch our documentary 'In Defense of Justice in Denver' Now:

#JusticeForElijahMcClain #DropTheChargesCO
